title.narrative: CO-Fair Finance Asia - Sida - Vietnam Pr

description.narrative:
The Fair Finance Asia Program (FFA) envisages to reduce the negative impact of national and cross-border bank investments in Asia on human rights, the environment and climate change, and to increase adequate financial services for pro-poor, inclusive economic development. The goal is to establish a sustainable financial sector in Asia, with financial sector institutions operating at national and regional level being more transparent and accountable and adhering to Economic, Social and Governance (ESG)-criteria. FFA is funded by Sida.
This project is implemented by Oxfam in Vietnam. It envisages to contribute to FFA by promoting environmental and social responsibility of commercial banks who are investing environmentally and socially sensitive projectssuch as coal power. They prioritize the energy sector, since this makes up the majority of regional loans to Vietnam and has the largest environmental impacts. In this project, the FFG coalition of Oxfam and partners in Vietnam will adopt the Fair FinanceGuide (FFG) to assess investment policies of Vietnamese and foreign banks investing in the coal power sector and do an in-depth study to assess environmental performance of some selected commercial banks. When investigating Vietnamese and foreign banks investing in coal power sectors, the Vietnamese coalition will specifically target Japanese banks, which are the 2nd largest investors in coal power plants in Vietnam: JBIC, Mitsubishi (MUFG), Mizuho, Sumitomo Mitsui (SMBC). Later they will also extend advocacy on coal power to banks from Vietnam, China, and other countries to the extent this is possible within the scope of FFA. Another focus is on Vietnamese banks investing in cross-border projects on hydropower, agriculture, and other issues: Vietinbank,others. Regionally, the Vietnamese coalition will join with Thailand and other countries targeting regional banks investing in hydropower (i.e. the six Thai banks funding the Xayaburi dam in Laos: Bankgok Bank, Kasikorn Bank, Krung Thai Bank, Siam Commercial Bank, TISCO, and EXIM bank).

mailing-address.narrative: PO box 30919, 2500 GX The Hague, The Netherlands

sector.narrative: The right to social and political participation
